docs.title: Install, Setup, Test & Cleanup
docs.text:
LinuxmacOSWindows 
# Example Linux install
curl -sSL https://example.com/locom/install.sh | bash

brew install locom

winget install locom

docs.title: Testing the tool
docs.text: locom --version

docs.title: Cleanup
docs.text: locom uninstall

docs.title: run
docs.text:
Run a task with the CLI.

mycli run <task_name>

docs.title: status
docs.text:
Check the status of tasks.

mycli status

docs.title: Welcome to My CLI Tool
docs.text:
Here’s a proof of concept showing tabs and rich formatting.

OverviewInstallationExamples

This is the overview tab. You can add Markdown styling like bold, italic, or lists:

  • Feature 1
  • Feature 2
  • Feature 3

Installation instructions go here:

pip install mycli

Examples tab:

mycli --help
mycli run task

You can also add collapsible sections:

Pro Tip

You can nest notes and highlights in Markdown.

docs.title: Basic Command
docs.text: mycli do-something

docs.title: Advanced Options
docs.text:
• --verbose : detailed output
  • --config FILE : specify config file

docs.title: locom
docs.text: locom manages a local stage of Docker Compose stacks

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: locom is a CLI tool for managing local Docker Compose stacks in a minimal, offline-friendly way.

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for locom

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• locom cert - Manage certificates for locom
  • locom hosts - Update /etc/hosts with entries from locom stage
  • locom init - Initialize a new locom stage in the specified folder
  • locom network - Ensure the Docker network defined in .locom/locom.yml exists
  • locom proxy - Create a default docker-compose configuration with Traefik proxy
  • locom version - Print version information

docs.title: locom cert
docs.text: Manage certificates for locom

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for cert

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• locom - locom manages a local stage of Docker Compose stacks
  • locom cert selfsigned - Generate a self-signed certificate for .locom.self

docs.title: locom cert selfsigned
docs.text: Generate a self-signed certificate for .locom.self

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for selfsigned

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• locom cert - Manage certificates for locom
  • locom cert selfsigned cleanup - Remove self-signed cert and its trust config
  • locom cert selfsigned setup - Generate a self-signed certificate for .locom.self
  • locom cert selfsigned trust - trust the self-signed certificate for .locom.self
  • locom cert selfsigned untrust - Remove/unregister the self-signed certificate from all trust stores

docs.title: locom cert selfsigned cleanup
docs.text:
Remove self-signed cert and its trust config

locom cert selfsigned cleanup [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for cleanup

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • locom cert selfsigned - Generate a self-signed certificate for .locom.self

docs.title: locom hosts
docs.text:
Update /etc/hosts with entries from locom stage

locom hosts [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help     help for hosts
      --verify   Check if the DNS name resolves and responds

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • locom - locom manages a local stage of Docker Compose stacks

docs.title: locom init
docs.text: Initialize a new locom stage in the specified folder

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Creates a .locom directory and a default locom.yml config file inside the given folder. Fails if the folder is not empty.

locom init [folder] [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for init

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • locom - locom manages a local stage of Docker Compose stacks
